servers.description: Endpoint to be used for cloud based installations. Access requires a token for authentication.
Endpoint when accessing the REST API locally.

info.title: SHARK WMS RESTAPI
info.description: SHARK WMS RESTAPI - Preliminary version of a rest based web service for SHARK WMS.

tags.name: ERP
tags.description: Used by host systems for order management.

get.summary: Search for one or more articles.
get.description: Get information about the specified article(s). Returns the relevant information.

parameters.name: articleNumber
parameters.description: Specify the article number to find. A procent sign can be used for pattern matching.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: For sites with multiple owners of the articles, specify the actually owner.

post.summary: Add or update master data for articles.
post.description: Master data is basic information about the articles. The most important information is the article number and description, but other information can be transferred as well. SHARK will create new articles and update the description, when met in an imported order, but the Master Data allows more information and will also work if SHARK is used with the Manual Transactions (transactions with no host-orders), this could be the case in an initial store process, where goods are moved from old locations into SHARK without orders.

201.description: The article is successfully created or updated.

parameters.name: articleNumber
parameters.description: Specify the article number to find. A procent sign can be used for pattern matching.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: For sites with multiple owners of the articles, specify the actually owner.

post.summary: Create a new order in SHARK.
post.description: Used to create all kind of orders in SHARK, like inbound, outbound and stock counting.

delete.description: Delete an order from SHARK. This is only possible, if the order is not working.

406.description: The order cannot be deleted, probably working.

post.description: Delete an order from SHARK. This is only possible, if the order is not working.

406.description: The order cannot be deleted, probably working.

get.description: Returns information about order transactions that has been fullfilled or canceled. Confirmations are logged as documents with an ID number. Store the returned next id and use that for the next call. The confirmations can be generated at order, order line or at transaction level, depending on the configured confirmation mode.

parameters.name: nextID
parameters.description: Return all confirmations from this ID and forward.

parameters.name: maxdocs
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries to return.

get.summary: Get a stock report from system.
get.description: Return a complete stock report as a snapshot when the call is received. This is typically requested when the two systems are in an idle state â€“ in other words, when no orders are in progress.
Return a list of all locations including stock

post.description: Subscribe to a webhook. Webhooks are user-defined HTTP callbacks. When a new confirmation is available in SHARK, it will post to the specified URL. Thereby polling can be avoided.

MiscFields.description: Optional fields used for keeping customized information.

erpcount.description: The Host systems stock quantity, used to compare SHARK stock with the Host stock.

locationstrategy.description: The storage strategy used either FIFO, FIXED or FLOATING

markForDeletion.description: If true the article will be deleted if possible else it will marked for later deletion. It cannot be used in new orders or put-away operations. The article cannot be deleted immediately, because it might have database references.

batchNumberRequired.description: If true a batch number must be registered when picked or stored.

serialNumberRequired.description: Set the serial number strategy used.

name.description: Name of the package, for example PCS. Stuck or Pallet. Default is P1

height.description: Height in meter of the article.

width.description: Width of the article in meter.

depth.description: Depth of the article in meter.

weight.description: Weight of the article in kg.

LocationTypeJS.description: This segment defines a location type where the article should be stored. The Location Type must exists as locations before this can be specified.

qty.description: Maximum quantity to store on this location type.

zone.description: Zone name where the articles can be stored. The zone must exists with locations.

ReplenishmentFrom.description: Name of zone to replenish from.

minQty.description: Reorder level of automatic replenishment (if supported)

maxQty.description: Maximum quantity to store in the zone.

replenishmentQty.description: Quantity to use for replenishment orders.

orderNumber.description: The order number is a reference number, that in combination with the OrderType and the DeliveryNoteNumber defines a unique order.

owner.description: Optional owner (company) of this order. In case an owner is specified, all articles in the order must be owned by the specified owner.

deliveryNoteNumber.description: A delivery number, a shipment number.

orderTypeID.description: OrderTypeID defines the type of the order. The default types are: 1=outbound (pick), 2=inbound (put-away). Other types can be defined as needed.

priority.description: Priority is a number between 0 and 255. Default is 127, 0 is lowest and 255 is express orders.

deliveryDate.description: Date the order should be delivered

shipment.description: Type of shipment. Information to the consolidation and shipment area and to an optional freight system.

carrier.description: Name of the transport company that will pick up a pick order.

tour.description: Orders can be picked to different tours. This parameter can be used to tell the system, that the order must be delivered with the specified tour.

gate.description: Where the order will be picked up, when leaving the warehouse.

partListNumber.description: Reference number for the part list

orderTypeID.description: This is the order type id used for the generated part list sub order.

asSubOrder.description: If true the part list will be created as a separat order else the part list will be expanded as pick lines in the general order.

storePickPartList.description: If true a put-away order will be created and the part list must be picked by the main order.

articleNumber.description: The article number is a unique identification of an article in combination with the Owner.

qty.description: Article quantity. Default decimal separator is .

articleNumber.description: The article number is a unique identification of an article in combination with the Owner.

qty.description: Article quantity. Default decimal separator is .

articleDescription.description: Article description may be added for inbound orders where the article may be unknown to the system. This is a simple way of creating new articles with basic information, without supplying master data.

batchNumber.description: Optional batch number for the articles.

batchDate.description: Batch date may be production or expire date.

lineNumber.description: An integer that will be used in the returned acknowledge and thereby creating a link between order a acknowledge lines. If not specified, a running number starting from 1 for each order, will be used.

location.description: Location address used to force picking from specific location or to select specific tray/module. The element has 3 optional attributes: Zone, Module, Tray. This element is only support by SHARK WCS.

unit.description: The article unit is the package size in SHARK.

note.description: The article unit is the package size in SHARK.

qualityInspection.description: Optional flag used with the Quality Inspection feature. It will force inspection at goods reception.

targetZone.description: Used for put-away orders to request the articles to go to a specific zone.

customerNumber.description: Customer number is a unique number for the customer. For purchase orders this is the supplier of the goods.

released.default: True if the order is released.

working.default: True if the order is processed.

consolidated.default: True if the order is consolidated (shipped)

cancelAllowed.default: True if the order can be cancelled (deleted).

url.description: URL that will be used as endpoint for the webhook.

includeContent.description: If true the document that is waiting will be included in the body of the webhook postin.
